name: State
computingDefinition: A way of organizing and storing related data in a computer memory
generalDefinition: the mental, emotional or physical condition that a person or thing is in

name: Props
computingDefinition: A way of organizing and storing related data in a computer memory
generalDefinition: A piece of wood, metal, etc. used to support something or keep it in position

name: Render method
computingDefinition: Rendering is the process of generating an image from a model (or models in what collectively could be called a scene file), by means of computer programs.
generalDefinition: To present something, especially when it is done officially

name: Prop drilling
computingDefinition: A way of passing down a special form of data (=props) from one building block of our app into another

name: Hooks
computingDefinition: A special type of function that is a part of React. Hooks give us special tools we need to pass down data or make Api calls.
generalDefinition: A curved piece of metal, plastic or wire for hanging things on, catching fish with, etc.

name: Event handling
computingDefinition: An action or series of actions that our program will take if the user performs a special action.
generalDefinition: A thing that happens, especially something important

name: Lists
computingDefinition: A way of organizing and storing related data in a computer memory
generalDefinition: A group or collection of things or people, often one that is large or impressive

name: Keys
computingDefinition: A special and unique name that React needs to identify a block of code. That block is part of a list of similar blocks.
generalDefinition: An explanation of the symbols used on a map or plan

name: Components
computingDefinition: A way of organizing and storing related data in a computer memory
generalDefinition: A piece of code code that can be reused and that forms a basic building block of our app. React apps are made up primarily of components

name: JSX
computingDefinition: A piece of content that can be rendered on screen as part of a webpage. It looks familiar so that it is easy to use, but it is unique to React.

name: Lifecycle
computingDefinition: The various states a building block of our app can be in while it is running. To make the process of coding easier, not all building blocks have them.
generalDefinition: The period of time during which something, for example a product, is developed and used

name: useEffect
computingDefinition: A special function that React can execute whenever our app changes in some specific way. We use useEffect to cause various side effects such as requesting data from somewhere when the user clicks a button.
generalDefinition: (effect) a change that somebody/something causes in somebody/something else; a result

name: useContext
computingDefinition: A special function that holds a body of data available everywhere in our app.
generalDefinition: The situation in which something happens and that helps you to understand it

name: useReducer
computingDefinition: A special function that React uses to make something happen in our app once some special action has taken place.
generalDefinition: (reduce) to make something less or smaller in size, quantity, price, etc.; to become less or smaller in size, quantity, etc.

name: useState
computingDefinition: A special function that React uses to change data or groups of related data.
generalDefinition: The mental, emotional or physical condition that a person or thing is in

name: Strict mode
computingDefinition: Something we can activate so that React gives us more and better feedback about our code.
generalDefinition: (strict) demanding that rules, especially rules about behaviour, should be obeyed

name: Composition
computingDefinition: A way of looking at the different parts of which our app is made.
generalDefinition: The different parts that something is made of; the way in which the different parts are organized
